creator: wschildbach@fermi.franken.de
text:
Created attachment 25078
Contains images, xsl-fo sources, fop.conf, to reproduce

Including png images with an alpha mask, rendering into a pdf file, works incorrectly. If the image is the first one to be included, acrobat throws an error message about a missing image. If it is the second to be included, the image is rendered incorrectly.

This bug only manifests itself when rendering to pdf; ps seems to be fine.

I have attached all materials to reproduce the bug. Call "doit.bat" to reproduce or see the different pdf files first.

creator: max@berger.name
text:
Dear Wolfgang,

thank you for this nice bug report - it had everything needed to reproduce and test the bug.

The error you are describing is already fixed in fop (trunk). This was a bug related to improper handling of colorspaces. It did not show up in the .ps output, as the image handling in .ps is different.

Max
batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
